node.title: Peter Dutton wins defamation case over refugee advocate's 'rape apologist' tweet
node.alt: Peter Dutton speaks in front of Australian flags
node.description: Defence Minister Peter Dutton is awarded $35,000Â in a defamation action against refugee advocate Shane Bazzi over a tweet which accused him of being "a rape apologist".
node.content:
["Defence Minister Peter Dutton has been awarded $35,000\u00a0in a defamation action against refugee advocate Shane Bazzi over a tweet that accused him of being \"a rape apologist\".", "The\u00a0now-deleted tweet was accompanied by a link to\u00a0a story published in The Guardian\u00a0in\u00a02019, containing\u00a0comments Mr Dutton made about women on Nauru\u00a0when he was Home Affairs Minister.", "Mr Bazzi had denied defaming Mr Dutton, saying he was only exercising fair comment and honest opinion.", "But today, the Federal Court found the tweet did defame Mr Dutton, and awarded damages.", "
Tweet 'went against who I am': Dutton
", "The Federal Court began hearing the case in October\u00a0after the parties were unable to agree on a settlement.", "Mr Dutton told the court he had\u00a0been the subject of many offensive and profane remarks over the years, but Mr Bazzi's comment was different.", "\"This went beyond that,\" Mr Dutton said.", "\"It went against who I am, my beliefs. This went to a different level.", "Mr Dutton said he found out about the tweet from his staff, and formed the view that it was more than someone having a rant about him, particularly because Mr Bazzi had\u00a0a blue tick on his account \u2014 meaning his account was verified by Twitter.", "The court heard he had accepted an apology from Senator Larissa Waters which included the same comment.", "The case will have to return to court next month, for the parties to argue over costs."]
